forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 3 to 21 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, the city awakens under a slightly veiled sky, where the remnants of evening clouds are giving way to a gentle embrace of sunlight. This early hour is crisp, with a low temperature lingering around fifty degrees, and a fresh breeze speaks of the West, carrying whispers of the sea. In the morning, a shy sun will confidently rise to a modest high of sixty-three, before retreating a touch as the afternoon creeps in, wrapping the day in a cool serenade.

Throughout the day, the promise of clarity shines forth, inviting the city’s inhabitants to venture outside and explore. Although the fog commonly cloaking the Golden Gate has decided to hang back today, a lingering marine layer may still kiss some of the coastal outlines, blending spectacularly with the city's renowned hills and skyline. This is an ideal day to don a light jacket over a comfortable shirt—layering is essential as the winds shift, teasing temperatures and occasionally igniting a cool, gentle breeze that will follow you as you roam. 

Consider meandering along the Embarcadero, grabbing a freshly brewed coffee, and simply enjoying the rhythm of the city—the symphony of footsteps, muted conversations, and the distant hum of waves all intermingling harmoniously. A stroll to a local bakery for a pastry might sweeten the experience even further, nourishing both body and soul as the day unfolds in its understated beauty.
